title: Criminal Justice Revisions

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
House/ received bill from Legislative Research in Clerk of the House
House/ 1st reading (Introduced) in House Rules Committee
House/ received fiscal note from Fiscal Analyst in House Rules Committee

general_provisions: This bill creates certain requirements for criminal justice agencies and entities working with criminal justice agencies.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>adds county attorney offices in counties of the second and third class to the statute requiring certain prosecutorial data collection and reporting regarding time spent on criminal cases;<hr><ltbullet>requires a county jail to:<hr><ltbullet1>collect biometric and other personal information for individuals brought to the county jail for processing or booking into custody regardless of whether the county jail retains custody of the individual; and<hr><ltbullet1>to the extent possible, connect an individual in custody with the individual's state identification number and use the state identification number in association with any records regarding the individual;<hr><ltbullet>amends the membership of the Public Safety Data Management Task Force;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Commission on Criminal and Juvenile Justice (the commission) to include certain DUI crash data in an annual DUI report;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Public Safety's Criminal Investigations and Technical Services Division to collect certain DUI crash data and provide the data to the commission;<hr><ltbullet>establishes law enforcement agency requirements concerning:<hr><ltbullet1>the collection and reporting of certain DUI crash data;<hr><ltbullet1>the sharing of information with the Department of Public Safety's statewide criminal intelligence system;<hr><ltbullet1>the collection and reporting of certain lost, stolen, and untraceable firearms; and<hr><ltbullet1>the collection and reporting of the disposition of firearms in the custody of a law enforcement agency;<hr><ltbullet>requires the commission to receive, compile, and publish law enforcement agency data concerning firearms;<hr><ltbullet>requires law enforcement agencies to supply certain law enforcement officers with a portable biometric capture device;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the public safety data portal is the repository for statutorily required data concerning:<hr><ltbullet1>certain DUI crash data;<hr><ltbullet1>law enforcement agency reporting requirements for certain firearms data; and<hr><ltbullet1>prosecutorial data collection regarding prosecutions of false sexual assault accusations;<hr><ltbullet>imposes certain requirements for software service vendors if the software service is for use by a criminal justice agency and collects and stores data required by statute to be reported to the commission;<hr><ltbullet>requires all prosecutorial agencies in the state to submit data to the commission concerning prosecutions brought against individuals based on false sexual assault accusations;<hr><ltbullet>exempts certain reporting requirements from law enforcement grant eligibility requirements; <hr><ltbullet>modifies pretrial release data reporting requirements from the Administrative Office of the Courts; <hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Corrections to conduct a risk assessment for every individual convicted of a sex offense that would require the individual to register on the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Corrections, until January 1, 2030, to submit the results of risk assessments for sex offenders to the commission; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
last_action: House/ received fiscal note from Fiscal Analyst

action_history.description: House/ received bill from Legislative Research
House/ received fiscal note from Fiscal Analyst
